name: TYC 3667-1280-1
scenarioDescription:
The TYC 3667-1280-1 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TYC 3667-1280-1 is a star with 1.87 times the mass of the Sun, and 6.26 times its radius. It is located 1568.81 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.35 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TYC 3667-1280-1 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TYC 3667-1280-1 system


TYC 3667-1280-1 b

TYC 3667-1280-1 b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.21 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TYC 3667-1280-1 b is 1717.2 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TYC 3667-1280-1 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system TYC 3667-1280-1, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by McDonald Observatory.
